title: Empowering Cocoa Farmers in Ghana
author: ClimateLab Team
excerpt: Through sustainable agroforestry practices, farmers in Ghana are increasing yields while restoring biodiversity.
content: Over the past decade, Suprefarm has worked with over 500 cocoa farmers in Ghana to adopt sustainable farming techniques. These practices have increased crop yields by 30% while reducing deforestation. Farmers now have access to premium markets and higher incomes.

title: Restoring Mangrove Forests in Indonesia
author: Jane Doe
excerpt: Mangrove restoration is helping protect coastal communities from rising sea levels and storms.
content: Our Indonesia program has replanted over 1 million mangrove trees, providing a natural barrier against storm surges and protecting marine biodiversity. This project also creates local jobs and supports eco-tourism.

title: Solar-Powered Irrigation in Kenya
author: John Smith
excerpt: Affordable solar technology is transforming agriculture in rural Kenya.
content: In rural Kenya, farmers face long dry seasons that threaten food security. ClimateLab introduced solar-powered irrigation systems, reducing dependence on expensive diesel pumps and increasing crop yields year-round.
